meta.title: About Gratia
meta.description: Understanding Gratia: Public, Shared, Sealed layers and field maintenance

header.title: About Gratia
header.subtitle: A practice space for recording what matters. No growth pressure. No engagement loops.

whatIs.title: What is Gratia
whatIs.p1: Gratia is a practice space. You record moments, thoughts, or observations without expectation of viral reach or algorithmic reward.
whatIs.p2: It supports three layers of visibility — Public, Shared, and Sealed — so you control who sees what. Nothing is monetized. Silence is always valid.

public.title: Public
public.body: Anyone can read. Plain, clear language. This layer is for ideas you’d comfortably share in a public square.

shared.title: Shared
shared.body: Visible to people you’ve invited. More context, more symbolic density. You decide who enters this layer.

sealed.title: Sealed
sealed.body: Private. Only you. This is where you write for yourself — no audience, no performance.

agency.title: Agency & Consent
agency.p1: Gratia respects boundaries. You choose what you publish, who you invite, and when to stay silent. There are no dark patterns nudging you to share more than you want.
agency.p2: Export your data anytime. Delete entries permanently. Your writing belongs to you, not the platform.

export.title: Export Boundaries
export.p1: You can export your content as structured data — JSON, Markdown, or CSV. Take it elsewhere if you wish. No lock-in.
export.p2: Gratia doesn’t claim ownership over your words. The field exists to serve your practice, not capture your attention.

maintenance.title: Field Maintenance
maintenance.p1: Gratia is held as a non-profit field. There’s no investor clock demanding growth or engagement.
maintenance.p2: Hosting can be supported through optional contributions. If you find the field useful, you can help maintain it. If not, you’re still welcome.

mediumMode.title: Medium Mode
mediumMode.p1: Medium Mode uses monospace typography to create space between you and the text.

sample.body: The light came through differently today. Not better or worse — just different. I noticed it, then moved on. Sometimes that’s enough.

footer.text: No ads. No tracking. No algorithmic feed. Just a field for practice.
